Description: Limestone ostracon, with remains of sixteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink, nine on one side and seven on the other.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.79, pl.59)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82723) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82723)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 59:1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
